alert.note: Alert for Lower Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 3:04PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A HEAVY SNOW SHOWER WILL AFFECT NORTHERN OCEAN...SOUTHEASTERN HUNTERDON...MERCER...NORTH CENTRAL BURLINGTON...SOMERSET... MONMOUTH...MIDDLESEX AND SOUTHEASTERN BUCKS COUNTIES... At 301 PM EST, heavy snow showers were located along a line extending from Bound Brook to Bordentown. Movement was east at 50 mph. Wind gusts up to 50 mph are possible with this squall. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Trenton, New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Long Branch, Asbury Park, Somerville, Sandy Hook, Somerset, Edison, Lakewood, Middletown, Old Bridge, Jackson, Howell, East Brunswick, Bridgewater, South Brunswick, Sayreville and North Brunswick. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 7 and 13. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 347 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 40. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 25 and 41. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 34. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 54 and 76. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 22. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 89 and 134. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
